title: We'll Be In Touch - A New Podcast From Stack Overflow!
description: Most job interviews are stressful. This one is not.
author: Kyle Mitofsky
excerpt: A new podcast from Stack Overflow focused on technical discussions between developers about learning, languages, bugs, projects, and more.
text: November 21, 2024Most job interviews are stressful. This one is not.Hello everyone and welcome to the very first episode of We'll Be in Touch, a new podcast series from Stack Overflow.This show will explore the world of job interviews, career development, and software engineering. Each episode, we'll sit down with folks working in software development to hear their stories, dive into their latest projects, learn about tricky bugs they've tackled, and discuss the tricks they use to keep up with all the latest languages and frameworks.I'm your host, Kyle Mitofsky, is a Senior Software Engineer here at Stack Overflow. I've been working as a developer for over a decade, and in my various roles, I've interviewed a wide range of people. I'm excited to be able to share these revealing and engaging conversations, WITHOUT the pressure of an actual job interview.Whether you're an aspiring developer or a seasoned professional, join me as we delve into meaningful discussions that can help shape your career. We're kicking off the series by chatting with a former colleague of mine, Yaakov Ellis, a longtime Stack Overflow community member and employee who currently holds a role as a Staff Engineer at Intuit.Connect with Kyle on LinkedIn, GitHub, and Stack Overflow. Connect with Yaakov Ellis on LinkedIn and Meta Stack Exchange.TRANSCRIPT
html:
November 21, 2024

Most job interviews are stressful. This one is not.

Hello everyone and welcome to the very first episode of We'll Be in Touch, a new podcast series from Stack Overflow.

This show will explore the world of job interviews, career development, and software engineering. Each episode, we'll sit down with folks working in software development to hear their stories, dive into their latest projects, learn about tricky bugs they've tackled, and discuss the tricks they use to keep up with all the latest languages and frameworks.

I'm your host, Kyle Mitofsky, is a Senior Software Engineer here at Stack Overflow. I've been working as a developer for over a decade, and in my various roles, I've interviewed a wide range of people. I'm excited to be able to share these revealing and engaging conversations, WITHOUT the pressure of an actual job interview.

Whether you're an aspiring developer or a seasoned professional, join me as we delve into meaningful discussions that can help shape your career. We're kicking off the series by chatting with a former colleague of mine, Yaakov Ellis, a longtime Stack Overflow community member and employee who currently holds a role as a Staff Engineer at Intuit.

Connect with Kyle on LinkedIn, GitHub, and Stack Overflow.

Connect with Yaakov Ellis on LinkedIn and Meta Stack Exchange.

TRANSCRIPT
